intro: Sorostachys, commonly known as the "false buttonweed," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences that resemble miniature umbrellas, often with bright red or orange bracts. The plants are typically annuals or short-lived perennials, growing in dry, disturbed soils across various regions. They have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers. Sorostachys species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions.
